availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Dunaway (Louisville, Kentucky, postmaster, farmer, and merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, postmaster, farmer, and merchant. North Carolina native. Married to Martha Ann Neal Dunaway in Oldham County, Kentucky, on December 29, 1838. Father of Columbus W. Dunaway and George Thomas Dunaway. Postmaster for Centerburg in Oldham County, Kentucky, from November 7, 1839, to March 31, 1840. Farmer in Spencer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Louisville, Kentucky, in 1859. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Resident of Vanderburgh County, Indiana, in 1863. Resident of Vanderburgh County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 108A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482446.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Jefferson County Wills, vol. 6-7, 1862-1872, p. 611-612.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Oldham County, Kentucky, vol. 12A, p. 410.
"Jefferson Circuit Court," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), November 9, 1859, p. 1.
"At Cost Price!" The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), December 15, 1860, p. 2.
Williamsâ€™ Evansville Directory, for 1865, (Evansville: E.J. Dobell, 1863), p. 81.
